result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylan J. Allison

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dylan J. Allison in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 16CM50, 15CM524, and 14CM457.
16CM50 Initial  Appearance:
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.

Case 14CM457:  AMENDED count to 961.41(3g)(b) Possess Controlled Substance.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CM457 No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CM457.  Clerk directed to enter a 961 Conditional Discharge deferred prosecution agreement and withhold Judgment of Conviction this date.
 16CM50 and 15CM524 are dismissed and read in.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson concurs with joint agreement.  

BY THE COURT:****961.47 Conditional Discharge deferred prosecution agreement (PROBATION)*******
12 months probation
Conditions:
$50 fine + $200 DNA surcharges + costs = $563.25
25 hours of Community Service, preferably with parks dept.
  AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
  Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
  Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
If successfully completes and recommended by the Agent, the matter will be dismissed.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: $500 Signature bond:  Comply with conditions of 14CM457.

Defendant Dylan J. Allison in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered.
State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Halverson requests signature bond.
BTC:  Court sets bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
